body_html: I don't have time for a detailed review right now, but a high-level comment: When storing meta-data for a particular pass like pretty printing, we do not modify structures in ir.h to hold it but instead create std::unordered_maps (e.g. std::unordred_map<Value*, std::string> original_name) that are local to the pass. This keeps implementation details of passes outside of the IR which is shared by many passes.

body: I don't have time for a detailed review right now, but a high-level comment:  When storing meta-data for a particular pass like pretty printing, we do not modify structures in ir.h to hold it but instead create std::unordered_maps (e.g. `std::unordred_map<Value*, std::string> original_name`) that are local to the pass. This keeps implementation details of passes outside of the IR which is shared by many passes.
